basics.name: Tejas Agrawal
basics.label: Student Researcher
basics.summary: Currently an undergrad in the final year at BITS Pilani, Goa, I am a student researcher with a keen interest in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, and Computer Vision. I am also a member of the [SAiDL]{https://www.saidl.in/} at BITS Pilani, Goa.

work.name: CSE Department, IIT Bombay
work.summary: Working on a project on advancing Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems on low-resource accented speech under the guidance of Prof. Preethi Jyothi.

work.name: APPCAIR, BITS Pilani
work.summary: Completed two project under the guidance of Senior Prof. Ashwin Srinivasan, Dr. Lovekesh Vig and Dr. Gautam Shroff: Firstly, I worked in collaboration with TCS research, to study and analyze the performance of LLM's ability to reason over arguments by introducing Argumentative Reasoning. Next, I worked on the extension of [CRMs]{https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.00738}, a form of 'explainable neural networks' by large-scale pretraining and examining their behaviour.

volunteer.summary: SAiDL is a student-led research group at BITS Pilani, Goa, working on research and applications of various fields in Machine Learning. I am a core member of the group and have worked on various projects, organised events and conducted courses.
highlights: Led introductory courses for ML and DL at my university
Worked on a Machine Learning Reproducbility Challenge(MLRC)

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

projects.name: Re: Teaching CLIP to Count to Ten
projects.summary: ◦ Reproducing the paper to train the CLIP model to improve the quantitative understanding of VLMs ◦ Making the implementation accessible for future researchers ◦ Collected specialized dataset to facilitate the training
